data.title: Our first look at Adam Devine and Sarah Hyland in P﻿itch Perfect: Bumper in Berlin is here
data.meta_description: Adam Devine reprises his role as Bumper Allen from the hugely successful Pitch Perfect film franchise. P﻿it...
data.text:
OK so we've all seen the trilogy of movies but now Pitch Perfect is coming to TV.

The best part? Stan has just dropped the first trailer for a new six-part series, P itch Perfect: Bumper in Berlin. Check out the trailer in the video above.

Sarah Hyland and Adam Devine rekindle their on-screen chemistry in the series, which premieres on November 24, only on Stan.

Adam Devine reprises his role as Bumper Allen from the hugely successful Pitch Perfect film franchise that grossed nearly $600 million at the worldwide box office.

T he series follows Bumper Allen as he moves to Germany to revive his music career after one of his songs becomes a big hit in Berlin.

If the trailer is anything to go by you can expect the spirit, charm and infectious musical style of the Pitch Perfect world audiences have already come to love.

And yes you guessed it, there's even a riff-off.

The series also stars Jameela Jamil (The Good Place) and Lera Abova (Anna) and Flula Borg (Pitch Perfect 2).

READ MORE: 1980s campy horror icon returns to screens

The comedy series is executive produced by Elizabeth Banks and Max Handelman, Paul Brooks, Richie Keen and Scott Neimeyer (Gold Circle Films), as well as Adam Devine and Megan Amram.

Brownstone and Gold Circle produced all three films in the Pitch Perfect series and Banks directed Pitch Perfect 2, which was the highest opening weekend for a musical in history, the biggest opener for a first-time feature film director, and the second-largest opening for a female director.

P itch Perfect: Bumper in Berlin premieres only on Stan on November 24.
